Text: Hear my prayer, O LORD; give ear to my pleas for mercy. In Your faithfulness answer me, in Your righteousness.
Context: David is pleading for God’s attention and help, emphasizing God‘s faithfulness and righteousness as the basis for answering him.

Text: Do not bring Your servant into judgment, for no one alive is righteous before You.
Context: David acknowledges the universal sinfulness of humanity and pleads for mercy rather than judgment.

Text: The enemy has pursued my soul; he has crushed my life to the ground; he has made me dwell in darkness like those long dead.
Context: David describes the severe oppression by his enemies which makes him feel as if he is close to death.

Text: So my spirit grows faint within me; my heart is dismayed within me.
Context: The intense pressure from his situation is causing David to lose hope and feel emotionally exhausted.

Text: I remember the days of old; I meditate on all Your works; I consider the work of Your hands.
Context: David finds some solace in recalling God’s past deeds and creation, which is a common biblical theme for finding encouragement.

Text: I stretch out my hands to You; my soul thirsts for You like a parched land. Selah
Context: David‘s desire for God is likened to a desperate need for water in a dry land, indicating a deep spiritual longing.

Text: Answer me quickly, O LORD; my spirit fails. Do not hide Your face from me, or I will be like those who go down to the pit.
Context: David urgently asks for a response from God, fearing death or complete despair if God does not intervene.

Text: Let the morning bring me word of Your unfailing love, for I have put my trust in You. Show me the way I should go, for to You I entrust my life.
Context: Despite his situation, David begins the morning with hope, trusting in God’s love and guidance for his life.

Text: Rescue me from my enemies, O LORD; I hide myself in You.
Context: David seeks protection and a place of safety in God, away from his enemies.

Text: Teach me to do Your will, for You are my God. May Your good Spirit lead me on level ground.
Context: David asks for guidance and teaching in God‘s will, referencing the Holy Spirit as a guide to stability and righteousness.

Text: For the sake of Your name, O LORD, preserve my life; in Your righteousness, bring my soul out of trouble.
Context: Appealing to God’s reputation and righteousness, David pleads for deliverance and the preservation of his life.

Text: And in Your loving devotion, silence my enemies and destroy all my foes, for I am Your servant.
Context: David calls for action against his enemies, basing his request on his relationship with God as His servant and on God‘s steadfast love.
